p: According to the EU’s official soil database [ 1], five Mediterranean countries have over 50% of the EU28′s shrublands, i.e., 16 Mha, of which slightly above half (8.4 Mha) are located in Spain. Currently, this large extent of shrubland is the result of several factors, namely, forest fires, abandonment of low productive cropland and/or extensive grazing, and global warming allowing sclerophyllous shrub species, which best cope with drought and high temperatures, to flourish [ 2].
